intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides subsp. orbiculatum, commonly known as the round-leaved bellflower, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its rounded, orbicular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often in meadows or along stream banks. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and can reach up to 30 cm in height. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
